data.title: Kellyn Trowse - Volleyball
data.meta_description: Kellyn Trowse (1) Outside Hitter  - 2022 (Senior): Ranked third on the team in total kills (120) ... Led the squad with six service aces during the Pirate Invitational

1 Kellyn Trowse

Bio

Biography

2022 (Senior): Ranked third on the team in total kills (120) ... Led the squad with six service aces during the Pirate Invitational ... Notched seven kills, 11 digs and three aces in the four-set victory over Furman to open the season ... Notched six kills, six digs and two aces versus Towson ... Tallied nine kills in the sweep of Norfolk State ... Registered two aces, two blocks and a season-best 17 digs in the narrow five-set loss to East Tennessee State ... Secured a season-high 10 kills as well as six digs, four blocks and a .409 hitting percentage against Notre Dame ... Collected six kills and nine digs in the road sweep of Old Dominion ... Posted seven kills, 12 digs and three blocks at Virginia ... Logged 16 digs at Tulsa before producing 10 at Wichita State ... Tallied nine kills and a .600 hitting percentage at Tulane.

At Elon: Tallied 167 kills, 216 digs and 25 aces as a COVID junior in helping lead Elon to a 17-11 overall record, 11-5 Colonial Athletic Association mark and an appearance in the CAA Tournament title match ... Recorded four double-doubles, including both matches in the CAA Tournament ... Notched 11 kills and 11 digs in the tournament semifinals against Hofstra before producing 13 kills and 12 digs in the five-set loss to Towson in the championship match ... Put together back-to-back double-doubles in the road doubleheader at Northeastern, tallying 11 kills and 14 digs in the opener before finishing the weekend with a 10-kill, 10-dig performance.

Spring 2021 (Junior): Played in six matches and 18 sets during the shortened COVID season ... Converted three of eight attempts in a win at UNC Greensboro ... Swung for a .273 clip with three kills on 11 attempts in Elon's victory over JMU.

2019 (Sophomore): Made 21 starts in 32 matches and 127 sets played ... Ranked second on the squad in kills (333) and points (376.0) ... Recorded 10 double-doubles, including four straight to begin the season ... Set new career highs of 18 kills, 21 digs and five blocks at Robert Morris ... Tallied 14 kills and 12 digs in a victory over Wake Forest ... Helped the Phoenix reach the CAA Tournament semifinals with 13 kills and 13 digs in a five-set win over Northeastern.

2018 (Freshman): Was named to the CAA All-Rookie Team and NCCSIA All-State Second Team ... Ranked second on the team in scoring with 226.5 points and 197 kills ... Finished her first collegiate match with three kills, two service aces, an assist, seven digs and three blocks against Presbyterian on the way to being named to the Charlotte Invitational All-Tournament Team ... Posted a season-high mark of 16 kills while adding seven digs and four blocks against Charlotte.

High School: A three-sport letter winner at Berkeley Preparatory School, Trowse was a four-year volleyball player, a four-year basketball player and a three-year track and field athlete…In volleyball, helped lead Berkeley to the Florida High School Athletic Association (FHSAA) Final Four in both of her junior and senior seasons, leading the Buccaneers to a 30-2 record as a senior on the way to winning the state championship in a five-set match where she finished with 17 kills on the way to earning Second Team All-State…Trowse was also named to the Berkeley Prep Invitational All-Tournament Team as a senior while picking up the team's Coaches Award and the Stallings Award, which recognizes the achievements of female athletes at the school…Played on the USA Volleyball High Performance A1 Team in 2014...Played on the Florida High Performance Volleyball Team from 2015-17, winning first place in the National abd International USAV High Performance Championships each year with Team Florida...Was selected to the USAV High Performance Volleyball International Youth All-Star Team in 2016...In track and field, Trowse was a regional finalist twice, finishing fourth place in 10th grade and third place 11th before being a district champion as a senior…In basketball, was a team captain as a senior and earned the team's MVP award while also winning Coaches' Award in each of her first three years…Played club volleyball for Tampa Elite and OTVA Elite...Was a member of National Honors Society, Social Sciences Honors Society and National English Honor Society while also serving as a Writing Center Peer Tutor and for Global Scholars and Prom Committee while making the Headmaster’s List all four years in high school. She was also an AP National Honors Scholar…Was the vice president of HOSA and the Medical Science Club and was the president and founder of the Law Club while also being a part of the Diversity Club, Rocketry Club, Math Club and Spanish Club...Volunteered at Metropolitan Ministries and Feeding America Tampa Bay.
